member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.AccessoryHandler
member.summary: This class contains methods to get instances of its sub-components, which contains the actual methods of specific accessories.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.AccessoryHandler.ProductIndex
member.summary: The index of the product to which this component handler belongs. The default product index is 0.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.AccessoryHandler.ComponentIndex
member.summary: The index of the component. It is unique for a type of components inside a product. It is useful when a product has multiple handlers of the same kind. If the product only has one handler of this kind, the index is 0. `AccessoryHandler` contains some sub-component of accessories.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.AccessoryHandler.GetSpotLightHandler(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets the instance of `SpotLightHandler`.
member.param: The sub-component index of the sub-component handler. It is used when the product supports multiple sub-components of the same kind.
member.returns: The handler. It is accessible even the component is not connected.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.AccessoryHandler.GetBeaconHandler(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets the instance of `BeaconHandler`.
member.param: The sub-component index of the sub-component handler. It is used when the product supports multiple sub-components of the same kind.
member.returns: The handler. It is accessible even the component is not connected.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.AccessoryHandler.GetSpeakerHandler(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets the instance of `SpeakerHandler`.
member.param: The sub-component index of the sub-component handler. It is used when the product supports multiple sub-components of the same kind.
member.returns: The handler. It is accessible even the component is not connected.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.AccessoryHandler.Finalize
member.summary: The destructor. It should not be called explicitly.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.BatteryHandler.GetFullChargeCapacityAsync
member.summary: Gets the event to receive changes of the total amount of energy, in mAh (milliamp hours), stored in the battery when the battery is fully charged. The energy of the battery at full charge changes over time as the battery continues to get used. Over time, as the battery continues to be recharged, the value of fullChargeCapacity will decrease.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.BatteryHandler.FullChargeCapacityChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the total amount of energy, in mAh (milliamp hours), stored in the battery when the battery is fully charged. The energy of the battery at full charge changes over time as the battery continues to get used. Over time, as the battery continues to be recharged, the value of fullChargeCapacity will decrease.

member.summary: Sets the camera's exposure mode. Check `CameraExposureMode` to view all possible camera exposure modes. Please note that in different exposure mode, it will have different values for the same setting.

member.summary: Gets the camera's shutter speed.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.SetShutterSpeedAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraShutterSpeedMsg)
member.summary: Sets the camera shutter speed. To see all available shutterSpeed value settings, see `CameraShutterSpeed`. The shutter speed should not be set slower than the video frame rate when the camera's mode is `RECORD_VIDEO`. For example, if the video frame rate is 30fps, the shutterSpeed must be <= 1/30. Precondition: The shutter speed can be set only when the camera exposure mode is Shutter mode or Manual mode.
member.param: A parameter object of type CameraShutterSpeedMsg.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.ShutterSpeedChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of shutter speeds.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraFocusTargetAsync
member.summary: Gets the camera's focus target point for auto-focus.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.SetCameraFocusTargetAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.DoublePoint2D)
member.summary: Sets the lens focus target point. When the focus mode is auto, the target point is the focal point. When the focus mode is manual, the target point is the zoom out area if the focus assistant is supported and enabled for the manual mode.
member.param: A parameter object of type DoublePoint2D.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraFocusTargetChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the camera's focus target.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraFocusRingValueAsync
member.summary: Gets the camera's focus ring value.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.SetCameraFocusRingValueAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.IntMsg)
member.summary: Set the focal distance by simulating the focus ring adjustment. Value can have a range of [0, `GetCameraFocusRingMaxValueAsync`], which represents infinity and the closest possible focal distance. For some lenses, the minimum focus ring value is larger than 0. For example the minimum of DJI MFT 15mm f/1.7 ASPH is 270. To retrieve the minimum value, perform the following steps: (1) Call `SetCameraFocusModeAsync` with `AF`. (2) Call `SetCameraFocusTargetAsync` with the furthest target (>30m). (3) Call `GetCameraFocusRingValueAsync` to get the current focus ring value. This is the minimum value. The maximum value can be retrieved using `GetCameraFocusRingMaxValueAsync`.
member.param: A parameter object of type IntMsg.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraFocusRingValueChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the camera's focus ring value.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraFocusRingMaxValueAsync
member.summary: Gets the focusing ring value's max value of the camera.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraFocusRingMaxValueChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the camera's focus ring max value.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraActualFocusAreaAsync
member.summary: Gets the actual area that the camera focused on. The focus target input by the user is a point. The camera will use an area around the target as reference for focusing.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraActualFocusAreaChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the camera's actual focus area. The focus target input by the user is a point. The camera will use an area around the target as reference for focusing.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraOpticalZoomSpecAsync
member.summary: Get the zoom lens profile. Includes focal length range and minimum focal length step. Supported by X5, X5R and X5S with zoom lens, Z3 camera and Z30 camera.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraOpticalZoomSpecChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the specification of the zoom lens. It is only supported by X5, X5R and X5S camera with lens Olympus M.Zuiko ED 14-42mm f/3.5-5.6 EZ, Z3 camera and Z30 camera.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraOpticalZoomFocalLengthAsync
member.summary: Gets zoom lens focal length in units of 0.1mm. It is only supported by X5, X5R and X5S camera with lens Olympus M.Zuiko ED 14-42mm f/3.5-5.6 EZ, Z3 camera and Z30 camera.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.SetCameraOpticalZoomFocalLengthAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.IntMsg)
member.summary: Sets focal length of the zoom lens. It is only supported by X5, X5R and X5S camera with lens Olympus M.Zuiko ED 14-42mm f/3.5-5.6 EZ, X5S camera with Panasonic Lumix 14-42mm/3.5-5.6 HD or Olympus M.Zuiko 9-18mm/4.0-5.6, Z3 camera and Z30 camera.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraOpticalZoomFocalLengthChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of zoom lens focal length in units of 0.1mm. It is only supported by X5, X5R and X5S camera with lens Olympus M.Zuiko ED 14-42mm f/3.5-5.6 EZ, Z3 camera and Z30 camera.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraStartContinuousOpticalZoomAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraContinuousOpticalZoomParam)
member.summary: Start changing the focal length of the lens in specified direction with specified speed. Focal length change (zooming) will halt when maximum or minimum focal lengths are reached, or stopContinuousOpticalZoomWithCompletion is called. It is only supported by X5, X5R and X5S camera on Osmo with lens Olympus M.Zuiko ED 14-42mm f/3.5-5.6 EZ, Z3 camera and Z30 camera.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraStopContinuousOpticalZoomAsync
member.summary: Called to stop focal length changing, when it currently is from calling `CameraStartContinuousOpticalZoomAsync`. It is only supported by X5, X5R and X5S camera on Osmo with lens Olympus M.Zuiko ED 14-42mm f/3.5-5.6 EZ, Z3 camera and Z30 camera.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraOpticalZoomSupportedAsync
member.summary: Get is optical zooming supported of the aircraft.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraOpticalZoomSupportedChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of is optical zoom supported by the aircraft.

member.summary: Gets the focus point counts in 2 dimensions. The focus points of a camera is finite and discrete.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraFocusPointCountChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the camera's focus point counts in 2 dimensions. The focus points of a camera is finite and discrete. The focus point counts of a camera is static. This event is only used to keep the subscriber post when a camera is connected.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetExposureMeteringPointCountAsync
member.summary: Gets the exposure spot metering point counts in 2 dimensions. The metering point counts of a camera is finite and discrete.

member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the camera's exposure spot metering point counts in 2 dimensions. The spot metering points of a camera is finite and discrete. The point counts of a camera is static. This event is only used to keep the subscriber post when a camera is connected.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraMeteringModeAsync
member.summary: Gets the camera's exposure metering.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetSpotMeteringTargetPointAsync
member.summary: Gets the spot metering area row index and column index. In order to make the method work, The camera exposure mode should be `PROGRAM`, `SHUTTER_PRIORITY` or `APERTURE_PRIORITY`, the exposure metering mode must be `SPOT`, and `GetAELockEnabledAsync` must be false.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.SetSpotMeteringTargetPointAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.IntPoint2D)
member.summary: Sets the spot metering area index. The valid spots are returned from `GetExposureMeteringPointCountAsync`. The row index increases top to bottom across the image. The column increases left to right. In order to make the method work, The camera exposure mode should be `PROGRAM`, `SHUTTER_PRIORITY` or `APERTURE_PRIORITY`, the exposure metering mode must be `SPOT`, and `GetAELockEnabledAsync` must be false.
member.param: A parameter object of type IntPoint2D.

member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the target point of spot metering.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.StartShootPhotoAsync
member.summary: Camera starts to take photo with one of the camera capture modes (shoot photo modes).Also, Precondition: 1. Camera must be in Shoot Photo mode. Some camera's may support shooting photos in Record Video mode. 2. The SD card or the internal storage state should be checked before this method is used to ensure sufficient space exists. Post condition: If the capture mode is either Burst or Interval, calling `StopShootPhotoAsync` will be required for the camera to stop taking photos.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.StopShootPhotoAsync
member.summary: Camera stops taking photos. Precondition: 1. `StartShootPhotoAsync` has been invoked and the shoot mode is either Interval or Time-lapse. 2. If the shoot mode is set to `NORMAL`, the camera will automatically stop taking the photo once the individual photo is taken.

For Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual, the watermark is only applied to photos and videos generated by the visual camera.

member.summary: Gets the Region of Interest.

member.summary: Sets the Region of Interest (ROI). Used to manage color range distribution across the screen to maximize contrast for regions of highest interest. Supported only by thermal imaging cameras.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraThermalROIChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the thermal ROI.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraThermalPaletteRangeAsync
member.summary: Gets range of the palette.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraThermalPaletteRangeChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the palette range.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraThermalPaletteAsync
member.summary: Gets the Palette.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.SetCameraThermalPaletteAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraThermalPaletteMsg)
member.summary: Sets the Palette. Each palette is a unique look-up table that maps 8-bit temperature values to different colors. Different palettes can be used to help the user better visualize temperature contrast or specific temperature bands. The valid range can be fetched from `GetCameraThermalPaletteRangeAsync`. Supported only by thermal imaging cameras.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraThermalPaletteChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the palette.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraThermalIsothermEnabledAsync
member.summary: Determines whether Isotherms are enabled. True if Isotherms are enabled. Supported only by thermal imaging cameras.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.SetCameraThermalIsothermEnabledAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.BoolMsg)
member.summary: Enable or disable Isotherms. Isotherms can be used to highlight specific temperature ranges: When disabled, all 256 values (8-bits) are dedicated to the temperature histogram of the scene. When enabled, only 128 values (0-127) are mapped linearly to temperature. Then three bands 128-175, 176-223 and 224-255 can be mapped to the user defined temperatures to highlight them to the user. Using some of the false color palettes (like RainbowIso) results in a thermal image that is grey scale except for three specific bands highlighted by either reds, blues or greens. Supported only by thermal imaging cameras.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraThermalIsothermEnabledChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of whether Isotherms are enabled. True if Isotherms are enabled. Supported only by thermal imaging cameras.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraThermalIsothermUpperValueAsync
member.summary: Sets the upper threshold value for Isotherm. All temperature values above this will use colors 224-255 from the palette. Supported only by thermal imaging cameras.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.SetCameraThermalIsothermUpperValueAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.IntMsg)
member.summary: Sets the upper threshold value for Isotherm. Temperature values between the lower and middle Isotherm threshold will be displayed with colors 128-175 from the palette. Supported only by thermal imaging cameras.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraThermalIsothermUpperValueChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the upper threshold value for Isotherm. Supported only by thermal imaging cameras.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraThermalIsothermMiddleValueAsync
member.summary: Gets the middle threshold value for Isotherm. Supported only by thermal imaging cameras.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.SetCameraThermalIsothermMiddleValueAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.IntMsg)
member.summary: Sets the middle threshold value for Isotherm. Temperature values between the middle and upper Isotherm threshold will be displayed with colors 176-223 from the palette. Supported only by thermal imaging cameras, except Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual thermal camera.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraThermalIsothermMiddleValueChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the middle threshold value for Isotherm. Supported only by thermal imaging cameras.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraThermalIsothermLowerValueAsync
member.summary: Gets the lower threshold value for Isotherm. Supported only by thermal imaging cameras.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.SetCameraThermalIsothermLowerValueAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.IntMsg)
member.summary: Sets the lower threshold value for Isotherm. Temperature values between the lower and middle Isotherm threshold will be displayed with colors 128-175 from the palette. Supported only by thermal imaging cameras.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraThermalIsothermLowerValueChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the lower threshold value for Isotherm. Supported only by thermal imaging cameras.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraThermalDualFeedVerticalAlignmentOffsetAsync
member.summary: Gets the vertical alignment offset between the video feeds from both the visual camera and the thermal camera. The alignment is applied to the MSX display mode. Different camera results in different value ranges. For XT2 camera, the valid range is [-8, 8]. For Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual, the valid range is [-40, 40]. Positive value will move the thermal window up. Only supported by XT2 camera and Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual camera.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.SetCameraThermalDualFeedVerticalAlignmentOffsetAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.IntMsg)
member.summary: Sets the vertical alignment offset between the video feeds from both the visual camera and the thermal camera. The alignment is applied to the MSX display mode. Different camera results in different value ranges. For XT2 camera, the valid range is [-8, 8]. For Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual, the valid range is [-40, 40]. Positive value will move the thermal window up. Use this setting to fine-tune the performance of MSX display mode and the align PIP mode. Only supported by XT2 camera and Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraThermalDualFeedVerticalAlignmentOffsetChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the vertical alignment offset between the video feeds from both the visual camera and the thermal camera. The alignment is applied to the MSX display mode. Different camera results in different value ranges. For XT2 camera, the valid range is [-8, 8]. For Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual, the valid range is [-40, 40]. Positive value will move the thermal window up. Only supported by XT2 camera and Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual camera.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.GetCameraThermalDualFeedHorizontalAlignmentOffsetAsync
member.summary: Gets the horizontal alignment offset between the video feeds from both the visual camera and the thermal camera. The alignment is applied to the MSX display mode. Different camera results in different value ranges. For XT2 camera, the valid range is [-100, 100]. For Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual, the valid range is [-40, 40]. Positive value will move the thermal window to the right. Only supported by XT2 camera and Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.SetCameraThermalDualFeedHorizontalAlignmentOffsetAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.IntMsg)
member.summary: Sets the horizontal alignment offset between the video feeds from both the visual camera and the thermal camera. The alignment is applied to the MSX display mode. Different camera results in different value ranges. For XT2 camera, the valid range is [-100, 100]. For Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual, the valid range is [-40, 40]. Positive value will move the thermal window to the right. Use this setting to fine-tune the performance of MSX display mode and the align PIP mode. Only supported by XT2 camera and Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.CameraHandler.CameraThermalDualFeedHorizontalAlignmentOffsetChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the horizontal alignment offset between the video feeds from both the visual camera and the thermal camera. The alignment is applied to the MSX display mode. Different camera results in different value ranges. For XT2 camera, the valid range is [-100, 100]. For Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual, the valid range is [-40, 40]. Positive value will move the thermal window to the right. Only supported by XT2 camera and Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual.

member.summary: This class contains components of the Intelligent Flight Assistant and provides methods to change its settings.

member.summary: The index of the product to which this component handler belongs. The default product index is 0.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.ComponentIndex
member.summary: The index of the component. It is unique for a type of components inside a product. It is useful when a product has multiple handlers of the same kind. If the product only has one handler of this kind, the index is 0.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.GetRTHObstacleAvoidanceEnabledAsync
member.summary: Determines if Obstacle Avoidance is enabled during RTH. This is only active when the environment is bright enough. It is not active when the aircraft is landing. CAUTION: If RTH Obstacle Avoidance is disabled, aircraft will not check obstacles during RTH or ascend to avoid obstacles, which may cause great risks.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.SetRTHObstacleAvoidanceEnabledAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.BoolMsg)
member.summary: Enables Obstacle Avoidance during RTH. This is only active when the environment is bright enough. It is not active when the aircraft is landing. CAUTION: If RTH Obstacle Avoidance is disabled, aircraft will not check obstacles during RTH or ascend to avoid obstacles, which may cause great risks.
member.param: A parameter object of type BoolMsg.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.RTHObstacleAvoidanceEnabledChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive the change about whether Obstacle Avoidance is enabled during RTH.

member.summary: Determines if the obstacle avoidance is enabled.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.ObstacleAvoidanceEnabledChanged

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.GetPrecisionLandingEnabledAsync
member.summary: Determines if precision landing is enabled. When enabled, the aircraft will record its take-off location visually (as well as with GPS). On a Return-To- Home action the aircraft will attempt to perform a precision landing using the additional visual information. This method only works on a Return-To-Home action when the home location is successfully recorded during take-off, and not changed during flight.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.SetPrecisionLandingEnabledAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.BoolMsg)
member.summary: Enables/disables precision landing. When enabled, the aircraft will record its take-off location visually (as well as with GPS). On a Return-To-Home action the aircraft will attempt to perform a precision landing using the additional visual information. This method only works on a Return-To-Home action when the home location is successfully recorded during take-off, and not changed during flight.
member.param: A parameter object of type BoolMsg.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.PrecisionLandingEnabledChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive the change about whether precision landing is enabled.

member.summary: Determines if the aircraft is performing precision landing.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.IsPerformingPrecisionLandingChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive the change about if the aircraft is perfoming precision landing.

member.summary: Determines if the aircraft's ascent is limited by obstacle. True if the aircraft will not ascend further because of an obstacle detected within 1m above it.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.IsAscentLimitedByObstacleChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive the change about is the aircraft's ascent limited by obstacle. True if the aircraft will not ascend further because of an obstacle detected within 1m above it.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.GetAdvancedPilotAssistanceSystemEnableAsync
member.summary: Determines whether the Advanced Pilot Assistance System (APAS) is enabled or not. When APAS is enabled, the aircraft continues to respond to user commands and plans its path according to both control stick inputs and the flight environment. APAS makes it easier to avoid obstacles and obtain smoother footage, and gives a better fly experiences. It is only supported by Mavic Air.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.SetAdvancedPilotAssistanceSystemEnableAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.BoolMsg)
member.summary: Enables the Advanced Pilot Assistance System (APAS). When APAS is enabled, the aircraft continues to respond to user commands and plans its path according to both control stick inputs and the flight environment. APAS makes it easier to avoid obstacles and obtain smoother footage, and gives a better fly experiences. It is only valid when the aircraft is in P-mode. It is supported by Mavic Air and Mavic 2 Series.
member.param: A parameter object of type BoolMsg.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.AdvancedPilotAssistanceSystemEnableChanged
member.summary: Subscribe event to receive the change about whether the Advanced Pilot Assistance System (APAS) is enabled or not. When APAS is enabled, the aircraft continues to respond to user commands and plans its path according to both control stick inputs and the flight environment. APAS makes it easier to avoid obstacles and obtain smoother footage, and gives a better fly experiences. It is only valid when the aircraft is in P-mode. It is supported by Mavic Air and Mavic 2 Series.

member.summary: Determines if Advanced Pilot Assistance System (APAS) is active. When it is active, the aircraft will change flight path automatically to avoid obstacles.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.IsAdvancedPilotAssistanceSystemActiveChanged
member.summary: Subscribe event to receive the change about whether the Advanced Pilot Assistance System (APAS) is active. When it is active, the aircraft will change flight path automatically to avoid obstacles.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.GetLandingProtectionEnabledAsync
member.summary: Determines if landing protection is enabled. During auto-landing, the downwards facing vision sensor will check if the ground surface is flat enough for a safe landing. If it is not and landing protection is enabled, then landing will abort and need to be manually performed by the user.

member.summary: Enables/disables landing protection. During auto-landing, the downwards facing vision sensor will check if the ground surface is flat enough for a safe landing. If it is not and landing protection is enabled, then landing will abort and need to be manually performed by the user.
member.param: A parameter object of type BoolMsg.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.LandingProtectionEnabledChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive the change about whether landing protection is enabled. During auto-landing, the downwards facing vision sensor will check if the ground surface is flat enough for a safe landing. If it is not and landing protection is enabled, then landing will abort and need to be manually performed by the user.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.GetUpwardsAvoidanceEnableAsync
member.summary: Determines if upward avoidance is enabled. When the aircraft's upwards-facing infrared sensor detects an obstacle, the aircraft will slow its ascent and maintain a minimum distance of 1 meter from the obstacle. The sensor has a 10-degree horizontal field of view (FOV) and 10-degree vertical FOV. The maximum detection distance is 5m.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.SetUpwardsAvoidanceEnableAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.BoolMsg)
member.summary: Enables/disables upward avoidance. When the aircraft's upwards-facing infrared sensor detects an obstacle, the aircraft will slow its ascent and maintain a minimum distance of 1 meter from the obstacle. The sensor has a 10-degree horizontal field of view (FOV) and 10-degree vertical FOV. The maximum detection distance is 5m.
member.param: A parameter object of type BoolMsg.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightAssistantHandler.UpwardsAvoidanceEnableChanged
member.summary: Subscribe event to receive the change about whether upward avoidance is enable. When the aircraft's upwards-facing infrared sensor detects an obstacle, the aircraft will slow its ascent and maintain a minimum distance of 1 meter from the obstacle. The sensor has a 10-degree horizontal field of view (FOV) and 10-degree vertical FOV. The maximum detection distance is 5m.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler
member.summary: This class contains components of the flight controller and provides methods to send different commands to the flight controller.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.ProductIndex
member.summary: The index of the product to which this component handler belongs. The default product index is 0.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.ComponentIndex
member.summary: The index of the component. It is unique for a type of components inside a product. It is useful when a product has multiple handlers of the same kind. If the product only has one handler of this kind, the index is 0.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.Finalize
member.summary: The destructor. It should not be called explicitly.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.StartTakeoffAsync
member.summary: Starts aircraft takeoff. Takeoff is considered complete when the aircraft is hovering 1.2 meters (4 feet) above the ground. The Task value is returned when aircraft crosses 0.5 meters (1.6 feet). If the motors are already on, this command cannot be executed.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.StopTakeoffAsync
member.summary: Stops aircraft takeoff. If called before `StartTakeoffAsync` is complete, the aircraft will cancel takeoff (`StartTakeoffAsync` task will return an error) and hover at the current height.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.StartAutoLandingAsync
member.summary: Starts auto-landing of the aircraft. The task value will return once aircraft begins to descend for auto-land.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.StopAutoLandingAsync
member.summary: Stops auto-landing of the aircraft. If called before `StartAutoLandingAsync` is complete, then the auto landing will be canceled (`StartAutoLandingAsync` task will return an error) and the aircraft will hover at its current location.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.StartCompasCalibrationAsync
member.summary: Starts compass calibration. Make sure there are no magnets or metal objects near the compass.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.StopCompassCalibrationAsync
member.summary: Stops compass calibration.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.StartGoHomeAsync
member.summary: The aircraft will start to go home. The task will return execution result once this method is invoked.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.StopGoHomeAsync
member.summary: The aircraft will stop going home and will hover in place.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.ConfirmLandingAsync
member.summary: Confirms continuation of landing action. When the clearance between the aircraft and the ground is less than 0.3m, the aircraft will pause landing and wait for user's confirmation. Can use `GetIsLandingConfirmationNeededAsync` to check if confirmation is needed. It is supported by flight controller firmware 3.2.0.0 and above.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.StartIMUCalibrationAsync
member.summary: Starts IMU calibration. For aircraft with multiple IMUs, this method will start the calibration of all IMUs. Keep the aircraft stationary and horizontal during calibration, which will take 5 to 10 minutes. The task result is returned once the calibration is started.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.GetIsLandingConfirmationNeededAsync
member.summary: Determines if the clearance between the aircraft and the ground is less than 0.3m, and confirmation from the user is needed to continue the landing. When the confirmation is needed, `ConfirmLandingAsync` can be used to continue landing. It is supported by flight controller firmware 3.2.0.0 or above.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.IsLandingConfirmationNeededChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes about whether confirmation from the user is needed to continue the landing. Confirmation is needed when the clearance between the aircraft and the ground is less than 0.3m, and the flight controller is not sure if it is safe to continue the landing. When the confirmation is needed, `ConfirmLandingAsync` can be used to continue landing. It is supported by flight controller firmware 3.2.0.0 or above.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.GetGoHomeHeightAsync
member.summary: Gets the minimum altitude (relative to the take-off location in meters) at which the aircraft must be before going home.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.SetGoHomeHeightAsync(DJI.WindowsSDK.IntMsg)
member.summary: Sets the minimum altitude, relative to where the aircraft took off, at which the aircraft must be before going home. This can be useful when the user foresees obstacles in the aircraft's flight path. If the aircraft's current altitude is higher than the minimum go home altitude, it will go home at its current altitude. The valid range for the altitude is from 20m to 500m.
member.param: A parameter object of type IntMsg.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.GoHomeHeightChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the flight controller's minimum altitude (relative to the take-off location in meters) at which the aircraft must be before going home.

member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the flight controller's estimated remaining flight time, in seconds. member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.GetMaxRadiusCanFlyAndGoHomeAsync
member.summary: Gets the maximum radius, in meters, an aircraft can fly from its home location and still make it all the way back home, based on altitude, distance, battery, etc. If the aircraft goes out farther than the max radius, it will fly as far back home as it can and land. If the aircraft is using the simulator, this value will be 0.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.MaxRadiusCanFlyAndGoHomeChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the maximum radius, in meters, an aircraft can fly from its home location and still make it all the way back home, based on altitude, distance, battery, etc. If the aircraft goes out farther than the max radius, it will fly as far back home as it can and land. If the aircraft is using the simulator, this value will be 0..

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.FlightControllerHandler.SmartRTHCountdownChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive changes of the flight controller's countdown (in seconds) for the Smart Return-To-Home (RTH). Once the countdown reaches 0, the aircraft will execute an automatic go-home procedure. .

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.RemoteControllerHandler
member.summary: This class represents the remote controller of the aircraft. It provides methods to change the settings of the physical remote controller. A remote controller is a device that can have a battery, radio, buttons, sticks, wheels, and output ports for video. The mobile device is connected to the remote controller, which is always sending out information about what everything is doing. The normal remote controller is called the master.

member.summary: The index of the component. It is unique for a type of components inside a product. It is useful when a product has multiple handlers of the same kind. If the product only has one handler of this kind, the index is 0.

member.summary: The destructor. It should not be called explicitly.

member.summary: This class provides methods to change the setting of the product's WiFi. Rebooting WiFi is required in order to make new settings take effect.

member.summary: The index of the product to which this component handler belongs. The default product index is 0.

member.summary: The index of the component. It is unique for a type of components inside a product. It is useful when a product has multiple handlers of the same kind. If the product only has one handler of this kind, the index is 0.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Components.ComponentManager.GetProductHandler(System.UInt32)

member.param: The product index of the product handler. SDK protentially may support multiple products in the future. However, only 0 index is currently supported.
member.returns: The handler. It is accessible even the product is not connected.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask
member.summary: MediaTask consist of task event and request. MediaTask should construct with `MediaTaskRequest`, Pass to MediaTaskManager to invoke the lifecycle event.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask.OnTaskListReqResponseHandler
member.summary: Delegate of task complete file list request event.
member.param: List of MediaFile request by task. See `MediaFile`

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask.OnTaskListReqForwardHandler
member.summary: Delegate of forward to next file list request event.
member.param: The count of MediaFileListRequest requests in this task.See `MediaFileListRequest`

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask.OnTaskDataReqResponseHandler
member.summary: Delegate of download file data transfer event, you should calculate how many bytes already download here.
member.param: Speed of download transfer in bit.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask.OnTaskDataReqForwardHandler
member.summary: Delegate of forward to next download file request event.
member.param: The count of MediaFileDownloadRequest requests in this task.See `MediaFileDownloadRequest`

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask.OnRequestTearDownHandler
member.summary: Delegate of task execute finished, if requests all successed, task invoke this event at last. If any request get failure, the task fail and invoke this event immediately.
member.param: Task already transfered all request, value 0 if none of them get failure.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask.OnListReqResponse
member.summary: MediaFileListRequest response event .See `OnTaskListReqResponseHandler`

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask.OnListReqForward
member.summary: MediaFileListRequest forward event .See `OnTaskListReqForwardHandler`

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask.OnDataReqResponse
member.summary: MediaFileDownloadRequest response event .See `OnTaskDataReqResponseHandler`

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask.OnDataReqForward
member.summary: MediaFileDownloadRequest forward event .See `OnTaskDataReqForwardHandler`

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask.OnRequestTearDown
member.summary: MediaTask have finished all requests event or occur request failure.See `OnRequestTearDownHandler`

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask.#ctor(DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskRequest)
member.summary: Construct a task with `MediaTaskRequest`.
member.param: The request taken by task. See `MediaTaskRequest`.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask.FromRequest(DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaFileListRequest)
member.summary: A convenience construct method of task with `MediaFileListRequest`. MediaTaskRequest will use "FILE_LIST" type, "NONE" duplicateType, "BACK_TO_QUEUE" deferType, "DEFAULT" priority
member.param: Convert to MediaTaskRequest with file list request. See `MediaFileListRequest`.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask.FromRequest(DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaFileDownloadRequest)
member.summary: A convenience construct method of task with `MediaFileDownloadRequest`. MediaTaskRequest will use "FILE_LIST" type, "NONE" duplicateType, "BACK_TO_QUEUE" deferType, "DEFAULT" priority
member.param: Convert to MediaTaskRequest with download file request. See `MediaFileDownloadRequest`.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask.Request
member.summary: Media task request passed by construct.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskManager
member.summary: MediaTaskManager provides methods for `MediaTask`.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskManager.#ctor(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Construct a task manager with `MediaTaskRequest`.
member.param: Which product that manager should access. Mostly should be use 0.
Which camera that manager should access. If hardware only have one camera, here should be use 0.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskManager.Suspend
member.summary: Flag to control the waiting task queue. After executing task complete, manager will check this flag to decide should begin next task. Attention set this flag will not effect current executing task. If you want pause task completely(both queue and data transfer), You should set this flag "True" first and call "DeferEexecuteTask". See `DeferExecuteTask`.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskManager.ProductId
member.summary: ProductId passed by construct.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskManager.CameraIndex
member.summary: CameraIndex passed by construct.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskManager.PushFront(DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask)
member.summary: Push a task to the front of the wait queue. This action will check task request parameter "duplicateType" to decide how to deal with the same infomation task. See `MediaTaskRequest`.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskManager.PushBack(DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask)
member.summary: Push a task to the back of the wait queue. This action will check task request parameter "duplicateType" to decide how to deal with the same infomation task. See `MediaTaskRequest`.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskManager.DeferExecuteTask
member.summary: Discard or backward current executing task to wait queue. This action will check executing task request parameter "deferType" to decide how to deal with it.See `MediaTaskRequest`. If deferType is "BACK_TO_QUEUE" , this action will postpone executing task event invoke. Otherwise deferType is "ABORT", this action will complete current task with error code "kErrorMediaTaskAbort".

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskManager.TrySync(DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask)
member.summary: Try to synchronize a task with duplicate request infomation. See `MediaTaskRequest`. If neither executing task nor waiting task have the duplicate request infomation, this action will return error code "kErrorMediaTaskSyncFailure". If this action successful attach to a eixst task, the parameter task's event will invoke simultaneously with eixst task.
member.param: Task will compare to those tasks already pushed. See `MediaTask`.
member.returns: Action error code, 0 define as no error.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskManager.Cancel(DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTask)
member.summary: Cancel task with duplicate request infomation, only effect executing and waiting tasks once in manager.
member.param: Task will compare to those tasks already pushed. See `MediaTask`.
member.returns: Action error code, 0 define as no error.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskManager.CancelAllTask
member.summary: Cancel all task ever pushed in manager.
member.returns: Action error code, 0 define as no error.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.AppActivationState.LOGIN_REQUIRED
member.summary: The application needs to be activated by the user through their DJI account. Use `UserAccountManager` to enable the user to log in. Log in is only required if the aircraft is located in China.

member.summary: The application is activated and flight restrictions turned off.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.AppActivationState.UNKNOWN

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.DJISDKManager
member.summary: This class is the entry point for using the SDK with a DJI product. Most importantly, this class is used to register the SDK, and to connect to and access the product. This class also provides access to important feature managers. SDK Registration using must be successful before the SDK can be used with a DJI product.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.DJISDKManager.SDKRegistrationStateChangedEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate type that use to subscribe the SDK registration state and error code if there is any error.
member.param: The error code if there is any error. It is valid when the state is `Failed`.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.DJISDKManager.SDKRegistrationStateChanged
member.summary: Subscribe the event to receive the change of SDK registration state.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.DJISDKManager.AppActivationStateChangedEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate type that use to subscribe the App Activation state.

member.summary: Delegate type that use to subscribe the aircraft binding state.

member.summary: Accesses to the virtual remote controller. It is used to control the aircraft's attitude when SDK is connected to the aircraft through WiFi without any physical remote controller.

member.summary: Accesses to the fly-zone manager. It is the entry of functionality related to DJI's GEO system.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.DJISDKManager.UserAccountManager
member.summary: Accesses to the user account manager. Login is required to access some features in fly-zone.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.DJISDKManager.WaypointMissionManager
member.summary: Accesses to the waypoint mission manager.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.DJISDKManager.RegisterApp(System.String)
member.summary: The first time the app is initialized after installation, the app connects to a DJI Server through the internet to verify the Application Key. The request will include the following information: - App key - Package ID - System platform, version and name - UUID generated by platform's API (`EasClientDeviceInformation.Id`) - System version Subsequent app starts will use locally cached verification information to register the app when the cached information is still valid.
member.param: The key used to register SDK for the application. This can be applied in DJI Develop Center.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.DJISDKManager.SDKRegistrationResultCode
member.summary: Determines if SDK is registered. This is the pre-condition of using most of the features in SDK.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.DJISDKManager.EnableDebugLogSystem
member.summary: Enables the debug log system. It will enable the DJI Windows SDK to collect logs that are related to the SDK's internal logic. These logs can be used to help diagnose SDK bugs. The debug log system is disabled by default. The developer can call this method in each life cycle of the application to enable the log system. The logs will be saved to directory named logs. The logs are under the application's local folder.
member.returns: Return true if SDK has been registered.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.DJISDKManager.DisableDebugLogSystem
member.summary: Disables the debug log system.
member.returns: Return true if SDK has been registered.

member.summary: Current Aircraft binding state.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.DJISDKManager.appActivationState
member.summary: Current App Activation state.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneType
member.summary: There are two types of fly zones, Circle and Polygon.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneType.Circle
member.summary: The circle fly zone is a cylinder or truncated cone volume (see `Shape`) with one of the four restriction levels (see `Category`). Some restrictions can be unlocked while others cannot. Some fly zones also have a 4km buffer around them where flight height is restricted to 120m.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneType.Polygon
member.summary: The Poly fly zone consists of one or more sub fly zones that are cylinders or complex volumes with different height limitations. A height limitation of 0m means flight is completely restricted.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneType.Unknown
member.summary: The fly zone is of unknown type.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneCategory
member.summary: An enum class represents the category of fly zone.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneCategory.Warning
member.summary: Warning zones do not restrict flight and are informational to alert the user. In a warning zone, users should be prompted with a warning message describing the zone.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneCategory.Authorizaion
member.summary: Authorization zones restrict flight by default, but can be unlocked by a GEO authorized user.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneCategory.Restricted
member.summary: Restricted zones restrict flight by default and cannot be unlocked by a GEO authorized user. Users should contact flysafe@dji.com if they have authorization to fly in a restricted zone.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneCategory.EnchanceWarning
member.summary: Enhanced warning zones do not restrict flight but are highly recommended to be informational to alert the user. In an enhanced warning zone, users should be prompted with a warning message describing the zone.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneCategory.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneInformation.StartTime
member.summary: The timestamp of when the flight warning or flight restriction begins, formatted in UTC (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss). This is used for temporary flight restrictions. When the time is not available from the server, `FlyZoneInformationInvalidTimestamp` will be returned.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneInformation.EndTime
member.summary: The timestamp of when the flight warning or flight restriction ends, formatted in UTC (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss). When the time is not available from the server, `FlyZoneInformationInvalidTimestamp` will be returned.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneInformation.UnlockStartTime

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneInformation.UnlockEndTime
member.summary: The timestamp the unlocked zone expires, formatted in UTC (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss). When the time is not available from the server, `FlyZoneInformationInvalidTimestamp` will be returned.

member.summary: Returns the reason of the fly zone `FlyZoneReason`.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneInformation.Category
member.summary: The category of the sub fly zone.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneInformation.SubFlyZones
member.summary: Information about the Sub fly zones. If empty, then the fly zone is a circle fly zone. If populated, this fly zone is a Poly fly zone and the sub fly zone information will take precedence over information in `FlyZoneInformation`. `FlyZoneInformation` should only be used for fly zone identifying information.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.CustomUnlockZone
member.summary: Users can unlock areas of a restricted fly zone through http://www.dji.com/flysafe/custom-unlock. A user needs to show special authorization (usually from a third party such as a regulatory or managing agency) as part of the process to unlock the area within the restricted fly zone. Therefore each request is unique and customized to the individual. If the request is successful, the unlocked area is tied to the user's account as an Custom Unlock Zone. This class contains the properties of an Custom Unlock Zone.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.CustomUnlockZone.ID
member.summary: The unique ID of the Custom Unlock Zone.
member.returns: An uint value of the ID.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.CustomUnlockZone.Name
member.summary: Name of the Custom Unlock Zone.
member.returns: A string value of the name.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.CustomUnlockZone.Center
member.summary: The coordinate of the Custom Unlock Zone's center.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.CustomUnlockZone.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the Custom Unlock Zone in meters.
member.returns: A double value of the radius.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.CustomUnlockZone.StartTime
member.summary: The timestamp of when the unlocking begins, formatted in UTC (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss). When the time is not available from the server, `FlyZoneInformationInvalidTimestamp` will be returned.
member.returns: A string value of start time.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.CustomUnlockZone.EndTime
member.summary: The timestamp of when the unlocking ends, formatted in UTC (YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss). When the time is not available from the server, `FlyZoneInformationInvalidTimestamp` will be returned.
member.returns: A string value of the end time.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneHandler
member.summary: Fly Zone Handler gives information about nearby fly zones, and APIs to unlock zones that can be unlocked. Depending on location, there are three types of fly zones possible: - `Circle`: Cylinder or truncated cone volume with four levels of restriction: - Warning Zones : no restriction - Enhanced warning zones : Flight restricted, can be unlocked for flight when the user logs into their DJI account - Authorization zones : Flight restricted, can be unlocked for flight when the user logs into their DJI account and the account has been authorized to unlock authorization zones. - Restricted zones : Flight restricted - `Polygon`: Fly zone that consists of one or more sub fly zones that are cylinders or complex volumes with different height limitations. A height limitation of 0 means flight is completely restricted.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneHandler.ProductIndex
member.summary: The index of the product to which this component handler belongs. The default product index is 0.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneHandler.GetFlyZonesInSurroundArea
member.summary: Gets all the fly zones within 10 km of the aircraft.
member.returns: Information of fly zones around the aircraft if the operation has no error. The information may be null when there is no fly zones around the aircraft.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneHandler.ReloadUnlockedZoneGroupsFromServer
member.summary: Reloads the unlocked zone groups unlocked by the current user's account from the server. For all products this includes both self unlocked and custom unlocked zones. Each unlocked zone group corresponds to one aircraft serial number. After launch, SDK will call this method once. It will call this method again when either the network connection or the current account state changes (e.g. when a new user successfully logs in). Call this method any other time to trigger the reloading manually. Calling this method will NOT synchronize the loaded zone groups onto the aircraft. To get a list of groups currently loaded from the server, call `GetLoadedUnlockedZoneGroups`. User will need to manually call `SyncUnlockedZoneGroupToAircraft` to synchronize the unlocked group to the connected aircraft after the unlocked zone groups are reloaded.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneHandler.GetLoadedUnlockedZoneGroups
member.summary: Gets the unlocked zone groups loaded from the server. Each zone group corresponds to one aircraft. The loaded zone groups will NOT be synchronized to the aircraft automatically. User need to manually invoke `SyncUnlockedZoneGroupToAircraft` to synchronize the unlocked zone group to the connected aircraft. Invoke `ReloadUnlockedZoneGroupsFromServer` to trigger the reloading of unlocked zone groups manually.
member.returns: Unlocked zone groups loaded from the server associated to the logged-in account. The result will be null when this is some error or there is no unlocked zone group associated to the logged-in account.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneHandler.SyncUnlockedZoneGroupToAircraft(DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.UnlockZoneGroup)
member.summary: Synchronizes the unlocked zone group to the connected aircraft. SDK will select the unlocked zone group that matches the serial number of the connected aircraft. After the unlocked zone group is synchronized to the aircraft successfully, the latest unlocked fly zones and the custom unlock zones on the aircraft can be checked by the follow methods: - Unlocked fly zones: `GetUnlockedFlyZonesForAircraft` - Custom unlock zones: `GetCustomUnlockZonesFromAircraft`

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneHandler.GetUnlockedFlyZonesForAircraft
member.summary: Gets a list of authorization fly zones unlocked by the account for the connected aircraft. It includes fly zones unlocked by the Flight Planner (http://www.dji.com/flysafe/geo-system#planner), and the ones unlocked during flight using DJI Go or any DJI Mobile/Windows SDK based application. This list does NOT include fly zones unlocked by custom unlocking.
member.returns: Information of unlocked fly zones on the aircraft if the operation has no error. The information may be null when there is no unlocked fly zones on the aircraft.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneHandler.UnlockFlyZones(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Unlocks the selected fly zones. This method can be used to unlock authorization zones. After unlocking the zones, flight will be unrestricted in those zones until the unlock expires. The unlocking record will be linked to the user's account and will be accessible to DJI Go and other DJI Mobile/Windows SDK based applications. Data Protection Notes - Calling this method will send the following protected data to DJI server: - User account information - The serial number of the connected aircraft.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneHandler.SetUnlockingEnabled(DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneInformation,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the enabled state to the selected authorization fly zone on the aircraft. This method can be used to set the enabled state for specific authorization fly zone currently on the aircraft. All authorization fly zones on the aircraft can be retrieved with `GetUnlockedFlyZonesForAircraft`.
member.param: The fly zone of to enabled.
The enabled state set to the authorization fly zone on the aircraft.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneHandler.GetUnlockingEnabled(DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneInformation)
member.summary: Get the enabled state of the selected authorization fly zone on the aircraft. All authorization fly zones on the aircraft can be retrieved with `GetUnlockedFlyZonesForAircraft`.
member.param: Get the enabled state of the selected authorization fly zone on the aircraft.
member.returns: The enabled state of the selected authorization fly zone on the aircraft. If the selected authorization fly zone could not be found on the aircraft, an unknown error code of the operation will be returned.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneHandler.GetCustomUnlockZonesFromAircraft
member.summary: Gets the Custom Unlock Zones currently on the aircraft.
member.returns: Customs unlock zones on the aircraft. The result will be null when there is some error or there is no custom unlock zones on the aircraft.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneHandler.DisableCustomUnlockZone
member.summary: Disables the custom unlock zone currently on the aircraft if there is. The currently enabled custom unlock zone can be retrieved with `GetEnabledCustomUnlockZone`.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneHandler.EnableCustomUnlockZone(DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.CustomUnlockZone)
member.summary: Enables an Custom Unlock Zones that is on the aircraft. All Custom Unlock Zones on the aircraft can be retrieved with `GetCustomUnlockZonesFromAircraft`. At any time, only one Custom Unlock Zone can be enabled. Enabling an Custom Unlock Zone will disable the previously enabled zone.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.FlySafe.FlyZoneHandler.GetEnabledCustomUnlockZone
member.returns: The currently enabled custom unlock zone on the aircraft. The result will be null when this is some error or there is no enabled custom unlock zone on the aircraft.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler
member.summary: `WaypointMissionHandler` can be used to run and monitor Waypoint Missions. It can be accessed from `WaypointMissionManager`.

member.name: P:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.ProductIndex
member.summary: The index of the product to which this component handler belongs. The default product index is 0.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.LoadMission(DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMission)
member.summary: Loads a waypoint mission into the device memory. A mission can be loaded only when the WaypointMissionState is one of the following:`READY_TO_UPLOAD` or `READY_TO_EXECUTE`. Calling LoadMission when the current state is READY_TO_EXECUTE will change the state to `READY_TO_UPLOAD`.
member.returns: The operation error code. When mission data is invalid or the mission cannot be loaded in the current state, the value is `PARAMETERS_SET_ERROR` or `INVALID_REQUEST_IN_CURRENT_STATE`.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.UploadMission
member.summary: Starts to upload the GetLoadedMission to the aircraft. It can only be called when the `GetCurrentState` is `READY_TO_UPLOAD`. If a timeout error occurs during the previous upload, the upload operation will resume from the previous break-point. After a mission is uploaded successfully, the `GetCurrentState` will become `READY_TO_EXECUTE`.The upload progress will be notify by `UploadStateChanged` .

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.RetryUploadMission
member.summary: Retry upload waypoint mission.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.CancelUploadMission
member.summary: Cancel upload mission . It can only be called when the `GetCurrentState` is `UPLOADING`

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.DownloadMission
member.summary: If app is restart and waypoint mission is executing,you need to download mission from aircraft. The operation will download information of each waypoint from aircraft and save it to `GetLoadedMission`. If a download operation is started, the manager will download the information of waypoints missing in `GetLoadedMission` one-by-one in ascending order. It can only be called when the `GetCurrentState` is one of the following: - `EXECUTING` - `EXECUTE_PAUSED`,The download progress will be notify by `DownloadStateChanged` .

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.RetryDownloadMission
member.summary: Retry downdownload waypoint mission.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.CancelDownloadMission
member.summary: Cancel download mission.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.StartMission
member.summary: Starts the execution of the uploaded mission. It can only be called when the `GetCurrentState` is `READY_TO_EXECUTE`. After a mission is started successfully, the `GetCurrentState` will become `EXECUTING`.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.StopMission
member.summary: Stops the executing or paused mission. It can only be called when the `GetCurrentState` is one of the following: - `EXECUTING` - `EXECUTE_PAUSED` After a mission is stopped successfully, `GetCurrentState` will become `READY_TO_UPLOAD`.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.PauseMission
member.summary: Pauses the executing mission. It can only be called when the `WaypointMissionState` is `EXECUTING`. After a mission is paused successfully, the `GetCurrentState` will become `EXECUTE_PAUSED`.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.ResumeMission
member.summary: Resumes the paused mission. It can only be called when the `GetCurrentState` is `EXECUTE_PAUSED`. After a mission is resumed successfully, the `GetCurrentState` will become `EXECUTING`.

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.UploadStateChanged
member.summary: Receive the event related to upload mission. See `UploadStateChangedEventHandler`

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.DownloadStateChanged
member.summary: Receive the event related to download mission. See `DownloadStateChangedEventHandler`

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.ExecutionStateChanged
member.summary: Receive the event related to execution. See `ExecutionStateChangedEventHandler`

member.name: E:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.StateChanged
member.summary: Receive the event related to current state change.See `StateChangedEventHandler`

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.GetCurrentState
member.summary: The current state of the manager.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.GetLoadedMission
member.summary: Gets the currently loaded mission of the manager. There are two ways to load a mission. 1. A mission can be loaded by user through loadMission. 2. If the aircraft is already executing a waypoint mission when SDK is re-connected, the manager will download part of the mission's information from the aircraft and load it automatically. In that case, the loaded mission will only contain the summary of the executing mission but information for each waypoint is absent. User can call DownloadMission to get all the information for the loaded mission. The loadedMission will be reset to null when the execution of the loadedMission is stopped, finished or interrupted.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.Mission.Waypoint.WaypointMissionHandler.GetLatestExecutionEvent
member.summary: The latest execution event cached by the manager. It will be reset to `null` after `LoadMission` is called.

member.name: M:DJI.WindowsSDK.UserAccount.UserAccountManager.CreateLoginView(System.Boolean)
member.summary: After invoking this method, a webview redirecting users to log into their DJI account will be created. The life cycle and the visibility of the webview is controlled by the developer. For end users outside of China, authorization is required to unlock authorization zones. After the login process, if `authorizationRequired` is YES, and the user is currently out of China and the account has not been authorized to unlock authorization zones, the webview will then redirect users to authorize their account.
member.param: If authorization is needed. If so, the view will jump to the authorization page after login.
member.returns: A webview that contains the login page.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraFocusMode
member.summary: Camera focus mode. For cameras with changeable lens, the focus mode is only valid when the physical AF switch on the camera is set to auto.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraFocusMode.MANUAL
member.summary: The camera's focus mode is set to manual. In this mode, user sets the focus ring value to adjust the focal distance.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraFocusMode.AF
member.summary: The camera's focus mode is set to auto. A focus target can be set by the user, which is used to calculate focus automatically.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraFocusMode.AFC
member.summary: The camera's focus mode is set to Continuous AF.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraFocusMode.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraExposureMode
member.summary: Camera exposure modes. The different exposure modes define whether Aperture, Shutter Speed, ISO can be set automatically or manually. Exposure compensation can be changed in all modes except Manual mode where it is not settable. Program Mode: Shutter: Auto Aperture: Auto ISO: Manual or Auto Shutter Priority: Shutter: Manual Aperture: Auto ISO: Manual or Auto Aperture Priority: Shutter: Auto Aperture: Manual ISO: Manual or Auto Manual Mode: Shutter: Manual Aperture: Manual ISO: Manual

member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.VideoResolution.RESOLUTION_NO_SSD_VIDEO
member.summary: The camera's SSD video resolution is unset. When the SSD resolution is unset, camera will not store video to SSD. SSD's resolution is determined by both license key and SD card's video frame rate. If there is no supported resolution with the current configuration, `RESOLUTION_NO_SSD_VIDEO` will be selected and user should adjust either the license or the frame rate.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraWorkMode
member.summary: Camera work modes.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraWorkMode.SHOOT_PHOTO
member.summary: Shoot photo mode. In this mode, the user can shoot photos.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraWorkMode.RECORD_VIDEO
member.summary: Record video mode. In this mode, the user can record videos.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraWorkMode.PLAYBACK
member.summary: Playback mode. In this mode, the user can preview photos and videos, and can delete files.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraWorkMode.MEDIA_DOWNLOAD
member.summary: In this mode, the user can download media to the Mobile Device.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraWorkMode.BROADCAST
member.summary: In this mode, live stream resolution and frame rate will be 1080i50 (PAL) or 720p60 (NTSC). In this mode videos can be recorded. Still photos can also be taken only when video is recording. The only way to exit broadcast mode is to change modes to `RECORD_VIDEO`. Only supported by Inspire 2.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraWorkMode.TRANSCODE
member.summary: In this mode, the user can download media to the Mobile Device.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraWorkMode.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraShootPhotoMode
member.summary: The ShootPhoto mode itself can have several modes.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraShootPhotoMode.NORMAL
member.summary: Sets the camera to take a single photo.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraShootPhotoMode.HDR
member.summary: Sets the camera to take an HDR photo.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraShootPhotoMode.BURST
member.summary: Set the camera to take multiple photos at once.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraShootPhotoMode.AEB
member.summary: Automatic Exposure Bracketing (AEB) capture. In this mode you can quickly take multiple shots (the default is 3) at different exposures without having to manually change any settings between frames.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraShootPhotoMode.INTERVAL
member.summary: Sets the camera to take a picture (or multiple pictures) continuously at a set time interval.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraShootPhotoMode.RAW_BURST
member.summary: Sets the camera to take a burst of RAW photos. Use rawPhotoBurstCount to check how many photos have been shot. Only supported by X5S.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraShootPhotoMode.EHDR
member.summary: Sets the camera to take an enhanced-HDR photo. It blends a sequence of photos for ghost-free high dynamic range photos. It is supported by Mavic 2 Zoom and Mavic 2 Pro.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraShootPhotoMode.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.summary: Toggles gimbal's pitch position, either point forward or point to the ground.

member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.GimbalMode
member.summary: Gimbal work modes.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.GimbalMode.FREE
member.summary: The gimbal can move independently of the aircraft's yaw. In this mode, even if the aircraft yaw changes, the camera will continue pointing in the same world direction.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.GimbalMode.FPV
member.summary: The gimbal's work mode is FPV mode. In this mode, the gimbal yaw will follow the aircraft's heading, and the gimbal roll will follow the RC's roll channel value. The pitch will be available to move.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.GimbalMode.YAW_FOLLOW
member.summary: The gimbal's work mode is such that it will follow the yaw. In this mode, the gimbal yaw will be fixed, while pitch and roll will be available to move.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.GimbalMode.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.summary: The mode of the gimbal angle rotation.

member.summary: The angle value, when the gimbal is rotating, relative to the current angle.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.GimbalAngleRotationMode.ABSOLUTE_ANGLE
member.summary: The angle value, when the gimbal is rotating, relative to 0 degrees (aircraft heading).

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.GimbalAngleRotationMode.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraFileIndexMode
member.summary: File index modes.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraFileIndexMode.RESET
member.summary: Camera will reset the newest file's index to be one larger than the largest number of photos taken on the SD card.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraFileIndexMode.SEQUENCE
member.summary: Camera will set the newest file's index to the larger of either the maximum number of photos taken on the SD card or the camera.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraFileIndexMode.UNKNOWN
member.summary: The mode is unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.BatteryHeatingState
member.summary: Provides the self-heating state for the battery. When the temperature of the battery is below a threshold, it will warm up automatically. For Mavic 2 Enterprise, the self-heating is triggered when the temperature is lower than 6 Celsius degrees. When the temperature reaches 8 Celsius degrees, the battery will start to preserve the temperature and maintain it between 6 Celsius degrees and 8 Celsius degrees.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.BatteryHeatingState.IDLE
member.summary: The auto heating feature is idle.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.BatteryHeatingState.HEATING
member.summary: The battery is warming itself up automatically.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.BatteryHeatingState.INSULATION
member.summary: The battery is preserving its temperature. For Mavic 2 Enterprise, the temperature will be maintained between 6 Celsius degrees and 8 Celsius degrees.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.BatteryHeatingState.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraZoomDirection
member.summary: The direction to adjust the camera zoom (camera focal length). Supported by X5, X5R and X5S with zoom lens, Z3 camera, Z30 camera, Mavic 2 Zoom camera and Mavic 2 Enterprise camera.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraZoomDirection.ZOOM_IN
member.summary: Lens will zoom in. The focal length increases, field of view becomes narrower and magnification is higher.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraZoomDirection.ZOOM_OUT
member.summary: Lens will zoom out. The focal length decreases, field of view becomes wider and magnification is lower.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraZoomDirection.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraZoomSpeed
member.summary: The speed of lens to zoom. The speed of lens to zoom. Supported by X5, X5R and X5S with zoom lens, Z3 camera, Z30 camera, Mavic 2 Zoom camera and Mavic 2 Enterprise camera.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraZoomSpeed.SLOWEST
member.summary: Lens zooms very in slowest speed.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraZoomSpeed.SLOW
member.summary: Lens zooms in slow speed.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraZoomSpeed.MODERATELY_SLOW
member.summary: Lens zooms in speed slightly slower than normal speed.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraZoomSpeed.NORMAL
member.summary: Lens zooms in normal speed.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraZoomSpeed.MODERATELY_FAST
member.summary: Lens zooms very in speed slightly faster than normal speed.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraZoomSpeed.FAST
member.summary: Lens zooms very in fast speed..

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraZoomSpeed.FASTEST
member.summary: Lens zooms very in fastest speed.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraZoomSpeed.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraDisplayMode
member.summary: Display modes to coordinate the video feeds from both the visual camera and the thermal camera. Only supported by XT2 camera and and Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual Camera.

member.summary: Displays only the video feed from the visual camera.

member.summary: Displays only the video feed from the thermal camera.

member.summary: Displays the video feed from the visual camera as the main subject, and the video from the thermal camera in a window not bigger than the main subject. Not supported by Mavic 2 Enterprise Dual.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.CameraDisplayMode.MSX
member.summary: Multi-Spectral Dynamic Imaging. Fuse the video feeds from both the visual camera and the thermal camera as one. Adds visible spectrum definition to IR images by detecting the edges of objects and including that detail in the thermal image.
