member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointActionType
member.summary: Waypoint action types.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointActionType.STAY
member.summary: Keeps the aircraft at the waypoint's location. The `int actionParam` parameter will determine how much time in milliseconds the aircraft will stay at the location with range of [0, 32767] milliseconds.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointActionType.START_TAKE_PHOTO
member.summary: Starts to shoot a photo. The `int actionParam` for the waypoint action will be ignored. The maximum time set to execute this waypoint action is 6 seconds. If the time while executing the waypoint action goes above 6 seconds, the aircraft will stop executing the waypoint action and will move on to the next waypoint action, if one exists.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointActionType.START_RECORD
member.summary: Starts recording. The `int actionParam` for the waypoint action will be ignored. The maximum time set to execute this waypoint action is 6 seconds. If the time while executing the waypoint action goes above 6 seconds (e.g. the camera is not present) the aircraft will stop executing the waypoint action and will move on to the next waypoint action, if one exists.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointActionType.STOP_RECORD
member.summary: Stops recording. The `int actionParam` for the waypoint action will be ignored. The maximum time set to execute this waypoint action is 6 seconds. If the time while executing the waypoint action goes above 6 seconds (e.g. the camera is not present) the aircraft will stop executing the waypoint action and will move on to the next waypoint action, if one exists.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointActionType.ROTATE_AIRCRAFT
member.summary: Rotates the aircraft's yaw. The rotation direction is determined by the waypoint's `WaypointTurnMode turnMode` property. The `int actionParam` value must be in the range of [-180, 180] degrees.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointActionType.GIMBAL_PITCH
member.summary: Rotates the gimbal's pitch. The `int actionParam` value should be in range [-90, 0] degrees.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointActionType.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointTurnMode
member.summary: How the aircraft will turn at a waypoint to transition between headings.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointTurnMode.CLOCKWISE
member.summary: Changes the heading of the aircraft by rotating the aircraft clockwise.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointTurnMode.COUNTER_CLOCKWISE
member.summary: Changes the heading of the aircraft by rotating the aircraft anti-clockwise.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointTurnMode.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionFinishedAction
member.summary: Actions taken when the waypoint mission has finished.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionFinishedAction.NO_ACTION
member.summary: No further action will be taken on completion of mission. At this point, the aircraft can be controlled by the remote controller.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionFinishedAction.GO_HOME
member.summary: The aircraft will go home when the mission is complete. If the aircraft is more than 20m away from the home point it will go home and land. Otherwise, it will land directly at the current location.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionFinishedAction.AUTO_LAND
member.summary: The aircraft will land automatically at the last waypoint.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionFinishedAction.GO_FIRST_WAYPOINT
member.summary: The aircraft will go back to its first waypoint and hover in position.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionFinishedAction.CONTINUE_UNTIL_END
member.summary: When the aircraft reaches its final waypoint, it will hover without ending the mission. The joystick can still be used to pull the aircraft back along its previous waypoints. The only way this mission can end is if stopMission is called.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionFinishedAction.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionHeadingMode
member.summary: Current waypoint mission heading mode.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionHeadingMode.AUTO
member.summary: Aircraft's heading will always be in the direction of flight.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionHeadingMode.USING_INITIAL_DIRECTION
member.summary: Aircraft's heading will be set to the heading when reaching the first waypoint. Before reaching the first waypoint, the aircraft's heading can be controlled by the remote controller. When the aircraft reaches the first waypoint, its heading will be fixed.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionHeadingMode.CONTROL_BY_REMOTE_CONTROLLER
member.summary: Aircraft's heading will be controlled by the remote controller.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionHeadingMode.USING_WAYPOINT_HEADING
member.summary: Aircraft's heading will be gradually set to the next waypoint heading while travelling between two adjacent waypoints.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionHeadingMode.TOWARD_POINT_OF_INTEREST
member.summary: Aircraft's heading will always toward point of interest.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionHeadingMode.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionFlightPathMode
member.summary: Waypoint mission flight path mode.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionFlightPathMode.NORMAL
member.summary: The flight path will be normal and the aircraft will move from one waypoint to the next in straight lines.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionFlightPathMode.CURVED
member.summary: The flight path will be curved and the aircraft will move from one waypoint to the next in a curved motion, adhering to the `double cornerRadiusInMeters`, which is set in `Waypoint`.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionFlightPathMode.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionGotoFirstWaypointMode
member.summary: This enum will determine the goto point mode while the drone executes the flight.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionGotoFirstWaypointMode.SAFELY
member.summary: Go to the waypoint safely. The aircraft will rise to the same altitude of the waypoint if the current altitude is lower then the waypoint altitude. It then goes to the waypoint coordinate from the current altitude, and proceeds to the altitude of the waypoint.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionGotoFirstWaypointMode.POINT_TO_POINT
member.summary: Go to the waypoint from the current aircraft point to the waypoint directly.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionGotoFirstWaypointMode.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionState
member.summary: All the possible state of waypoint mission handler.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionState.DISCONNECTED
member.summary: The connection between the mobile device, remote controller and aircraft is broken.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionState.RECOVERING
member.summary: The connection between the mobile device, remote controller and aircraft is built-up. The operator is synchronizing the state from the aircraft.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionState.NOT_SUPPORTED
member.summary: The connected product does not support waypoint mission.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionState.READY_TO_UPLOAD
member.summary: The aircraft is ready to upload a mission.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionState.UPLOADING
member.summary: The uploading is started successfully. Detail information for each waypoint is being uploaded one by one.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionState.READY_TO_EXECUTE
member.summary: Waypoint mission is uploaded completely and the aircraft is ready to start the execution.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionState.EXECUTING
member.summary: The execution is started successfully.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionState.EXECUTE_PAUSED
member.summary: Waypoint mission is paused successfully. User can call resume mission to continue the execution.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionState.UNKNOWN
member.summary: The state of the operator is unknown. It is the initial state when the handler is just created.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionExecuteState
member.summary: Current waypoint mission state.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionExecuteState.INITIALIZING
member.summary: Waypoint mission is initializing, which means the mission has started and the aircraft is going to the first waypoint.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionExecuteState.MOVING
member.summary: Aircraft is currently moving toward the mission's next waypoint. This happens when the `WaypointMissionFlightPathMode flightPathMode` is set to `NORMAL`.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionExecuteState.CURVE_MODE_MOVING
member.summary: Aircraft is currently moving. This happens when the `WaypointMissionFlightPathMode flightPathMode` is set to `CURVED`.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionExecuteState.CURVE_MODE_TURNING
member.summary: Aircraft is currently turning. This happens when the `WaypointMissionFlightPathMode flightPathMode` is set to `CURVED`.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionExecuteState.BEGIN_ACTION
member.summary: Aircraft has reached a waypoint, has rotated to the new heading and is now processing actions. This state will be called before the waypoint actions starts executing and will occur for each waypoint action.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionExecuteState.DOING_ACTION
member.summary: Aircraft is at a waypoint and is executing an action.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionExecuteState.FINISHED_ACTION
member.summary: Aircraft is at a waypoint and has finished executing the current waypoint action. This state occurs once for each waypoint action.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionExecuteState.RETURN_TO_FIRST_POINT
member.summary: Aircraft has returned to the first waypoint. This happens when the `WaypointMissionFinishedAction finishedAction` is set to `GO_FIRST_WAYPOINT`.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionExecuteState.PAUSED
member.summary: The mission is currently paused by the user.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMissionExecuteState.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.FCGPSSignalLevel
member.summary: GPS signal levels, which are used to measure the signal quality.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FCGPSSignalLevel.LEVEL_0
member.summary: The GPS has almost no signal, which is very bad.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FCGPSSignalLevel.LEVEL_1
member.summary: The GPS signal is very weak.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FCGPSSignalLevel.LEVEL_2
member.summary: The GPS signal is weak. At this level, the aircraft's go home functionality will still work.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FCGPSSignalLevel.LEVEL_3
member.summary: The GPS signal is good. At this level, the aircraft can hover in the air.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FCGPSSignalLevel.LEVEL_4
member.summary: The GPS signal is very good. At this level, the aircraft can record the home point.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FCGPSSignalLevel.LEVEL_5
member.summary: The GPS signal is very strong.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FCGPSSignalLevel.LEVEL_None
member.summary: There is no GPS signal.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.FCGPSSignalLevel.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.AircraftBindingState
member.summary: The aircraft's binding state.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.AircraftBindingState.INITIAL
member.summary: The binding state of the aircraft is not yet determined. The aircraft will only be in this state until DJI Go or a DJI Mobile SDK based application rights the binding information to the aircraft. Binding is only required if the user is in China. If the user is not in China, then this state will become `NOT_REQUIRED` after the country code check is complete. In this state, the aircraft will have the 30m height and 50m radius limitation.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.AircraftBindingState.UNBOUND
member.summary: The aircraft is not currently bound, and needs to be (as it is in China). In this state, the aircraft will have 30m max flight height and 50m max flight distance limitation. User should finish the one-off binding process with DJI Go to remove the flight limitation.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.AircraftBindingState.UNBOUND_BUT_CANNOT_SYNC
member.summary: The aircraft is flying inside China and is unbound. The aircraft can be bound using DJI Go. If DJI Go is connected to the aircraft, then the binding will be stored in the aircraft. If DJI Go is not connected to the aircraft during the binding process, then the binding result will be stored on a server. The SDK can query this server to see if the binding has already happened, and if it has, download the binding to the aircraft. However, if the aircraft is unbound, and the server is not reachable, then this state will be presented. The user should connect the mobile device to the Internet to refresh this state.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.AircraftBindingState.BOUND
member.summary: The aircraft is bound.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.AircraftBindingState.NOT_REQUIRED
member.summary: The aircraft is not bound but it is not currently located in China. Therefore, binding the aircraft is not required.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.AircraftBindingState.NOT_SUPORTED
member.summary: The aircraft's firmware does not support the App Activation system.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.AircraftBindingState.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Either the aircraft is disconnected or the connected product is not a DJI aircraft.

member.summary: The aircraft is unlocked.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.AirSenseWarningLevel
member.summary: The warning level determined by the DJI AirSense system. The warning level is based on the distance between the airplane and the DJI aircraft, and the heading of the airplane.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.AirSenseWarningLevel.LEVEL_0
member.summary: The system detects the airplane but the DJI aircraft is either far away from the airplane or is in the opposite direction of the airplane's heading.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.AirSenseWarningLevel.LEVEL_1
member.summary: The system detects the airplane. The probability that it will pass through the location of the DJI aircraft is considered low.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.AirSenseWarningLevel.LEVEL_2
member.summary: The system detects the airplane. The probability that it will pass through the location of the DJI aircraft is considered medium.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.AirSenseWarningLevel.LEVEL_3
member.summary: The system detects the airplane. The probability that it will pass through the location of the DJI aircraft is considered high.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.AirSenseWarningLevel.LEVEL_4
member.summary: The system detects the airplane. The probability that it will pass through the location of the DJI aircraft is very high.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.AirSenseWarningLevel.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.RCFlightModeSwitch
member.summary: Remote Controller Flight Mode switch position.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.RCFlightModeSwitch.SWITCH_ONE
member.summary: Position One. For all products except Mavic Pro, this is the left most position of the flight mode switch on a remote controller from the perspective of the pilot. For example, on a Phantom 4 remote controller, Position One is labeled "A". For Mavic Pro, Spark and Mavic Air, this is the position that is furthest away from the pilot and labeled "Sport".

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.RCFlightModeSwitch.SWITCH_TWO
member.summary: Position Two. For all products except Mavic Pro, this is the middle position of the flight mode switch on a remote controller from the perspective of the pilot. For example, on a Phantom 4 remote controller, Position Two is labeled "S". For Mavic Pro, Spark and Mavic Air, this is the position that is closest to the pilot (the P position).

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.RCFlightModeSwitch.SWITCH_THREE
member.summary: Position Three. For all products except Mavic Pro, this is the right most position of the flight mode switch on a remote controller from the perspective of the pilot. For example, on a Phantom 4 remote controller, Position Two is labeled "P". Mavic Pro, Spark or Mavic Air does not have a third position for the flight mode switch.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.RCFlightModeSwitch.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.BottomAuxiliaryLightMode
member.summary: Modes for the auxiliary light at the bottom of the aircraft.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.BottomAuxiliaryLightMode.AUTO
member.summary: The auto mode. In this mode, the auxiliary light will be turned on automatically when the downward vision system is active but the environment is too dark.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.BottomAuxiliaryLightMode.ON
member.summary: The auxiliary light is on.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.BottomAuxiliaryLightMode.OFF
member.summary: The auxiliary light is off.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.BottomAuxiliaryLightMode.BEACON
member.summary: Beacon mode. In this mode, the auxiliary light will have different behaviors in different conditions: - When the aircraft just takes off, the auxiliary light will have the same behavior as ''DJIBottomAuxiliaryLightMode_Auto''. - When the aircraft ascends above 5.5 meters, the auxiliary light starts to blink in 1Hz. - When the aircraft descends below 4.5 meters, the auxiliary light will have the same behavior as ''DJIBottomAuxiliaryLightMode_Auto''. This mode is only supported by Mavic 2 Enterprise.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.BottomAuxiliaryLightMode.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.summary: This flag indicate this media file is not tagged star/favorite/like.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaFileStarTag.TAGGED
member.summary: This flag indicate this media file is tagged star/favorite/like.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaRequestType
member.summary: This flag indicate type of file transfer request. See `MediaFileDownloadRequest`.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaRequestType.ORIGIN
member.summary: This flag indicate this request want to get origin file data.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaRequestType.THUMBNAIL
member.summary: This flag indicate this request want to get thumbnail file data. Thumbnail is the smallest size picture of photo or video first frame.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaRequestType.SCREEN
member.summary: This flag indicate this request want to get screen(preview) file data. Screen is the smaller size picture of photo or video first frame.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaRequestType.CLIP
member.summary: This flag indicate this request want to get partial file data. Only valid when file is video.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaRequestType.STREAM
member.summary: This flag indicate this request want to transfer with stream.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaRequestType.PANO
member.summary: This flag indicate this request want to get origin panorama file data. Only valid when file is panorama.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaRequestType.PANOSCREENNAIL
member.summary: This flag indicate this request want to get screen panorama file data. Only valid when file is panorama.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaRequestType.PANOTHUMBNAIL
member.summary: This flag indicate this request want to get thumbnail panorama file data. Only valid when file is panorama.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaRequestType.UNKNOWN
member.summary: This enumerate use for system error, should not use by developer.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaFileListLocation.SD_CARD
member.summary: The media file location at default SD Card.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaFileListLocation.INTERNAL_STORAGE
member.summary: The media file location at Embedded Multi Media Card(EMMC).

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaFileListLocation.EXTENDED_SD_CARD
member.summary: The media file location at external SD Card.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaFileListLocation.UNKNOWN
member.summary: This enumerate use for system error, should not use by developer.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskType
member.summary: The media task type. using in `MediaTaskRequest` and `MediaTaskResponse`

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskType.FILE_DATA
member.summary: In `MediaTaskRequest` indicate transfer `MediaFileDownloadRequest` first. In `MediaTaskResponse` indicate this response from `MediaFileDownloadRequest`.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskType.FILE_LIST
member.summary: In `MediaTaskRequest` indicate transfer `MediaFileListRequest` first. In `MediaTaskResponse` indicate this response from `MediaFileListRequest`.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskType.UNKNOWN
member.summary: This enumerate use for system error, should not use by developer.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskDuplicate
member.summary: The flag for control the effect to duplicate request waiting tasks when PushFront/PushBack and task finished

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskDuplicate.NONE
member.summary: When this task push in or successed, do nothing with other tasks.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskDuplicate.ENQUEUE_WITH_CANCEL
member.summary: When this task push in, cancel other tasks both executing and waiting.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskDuplicate.DEQUEUE_WITH_COMPLETE
member.summary: When this task successful complete, complete other tasks in waiting queue. It will make some task complete even not actually begin executing.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskDuplicate.UNKNOWN
member.summary: This enumerate use for system error, should not use by developer.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskDefer
member.summary: The flag for control how to deal with this task, when DeferExecuteTask apply on it.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskDefer.BACK_TO_QUEUE
member.summary: When DeferExecuteTask perform on this task, it will be save context and back to the front of waiting queue. The event you register on it will pause until it execute again, but not invoke any err code, so you will not receive the teardown event.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskDefer.ABORT
member.summary: When DeferExecuteTask perform on this task, it will be abort directly and invoke err code "kErrorMediaTaskAbort" and imediately receive the teardown event.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskDefer.UNKNOWN
member.summary: This enumerate use for system error, should not use by developer.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskPriority
member.summary: The flag for control execute sequence. Final execute task will be decided by postion in waiting queue and priority. Manager will loop tasks from front to back to pick up the first highest priority tasks. If you want guarantee a task execute next, task should be pushfront with high priority.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskPriority.DEFAULT
member.summary: Execute task with default priority, same mean as low.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskPriority.MIDDLE
member.summary: Execute task with middle priority.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskPriority.HIGH
member.summary: Execute task with high priority.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.MediaTaskPriority.UNKNOWN
member.summary: This enumerate use for system error, should not use by developer.

member.summary: The rotation mode, either it is relative or absolute.

member.summary: The pitch property of a gimbal rotation operation, how much the gimbal rotates on the pitch axis. It only takes effect when `bool pitchIgnored` is false.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.GimbalAngleRotation.roll
member.summary: The roll property of a gimbal rotation operation, how much the gimbal rotates on the pitch axis. It only takes effect when `bool rollIgnored` is false.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.GimbalAngleRotation.yaw
member.summary: The yaw property of a gimbal rotation operation, how much the gimbal rotates on the pitch axis. It only takes effect when `bool yawIgnored` is false.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.GimbalAngleRotation.pitchIgnored
member.summary: true to ignore the pitch value of this rotation so that the gimbal will not rotate pitch.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.GimbalAngleRotation.rollIgnored
member.summary: true to ignore the roll value of this rotation so that the gimbal will not rotate roll.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.GimbalAngleRotation.yawIgnored
member.summary: true to ignore the yaw value of this rotation so that the gimbal will not rotate yaw.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.GimbalAngleRotation.duration
member.summary: The duration for the rotation operation. A longer duration can slower the rotation.

member.summary: Sets the number of pictures, and sets the time interval between pictures for the Interval shoot photo mode.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.PhotoIntervalShootSettings.count
member.summary: The number of photos to capture. The value range is [2, 255]. If 255 is selected, then the camera will continue to take pictures until `StopShootPhotoAsync` is called. For thermal imaging camera and Z30 camera, it can only be set to 255.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.PhotoIntervalShootSettings.interval
member.summary: The time interval between when two photos are taken. The range for this parameter depends the photo file format(`PhotoStorageFormat`). When the file format is JPEG, the range is [2, 2^16 - 1] seconds; when the file format is RAW or RAW+JPEG, the range is [10, 2^16 - 1] seconds.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.Waypoint
member.summary: The class represents a target point in the waypoint mission. For a waypoint mission, a flight route consists of multiple `Waypoint` objects. The user can also define the actions to perform for each `Waypoint`.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.Waypoint.location
member.summary: Waypoint latitude and longitude in degrees.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.Waypoint.altitude
member.summary: Altitude of the aircraft in meters when it reaches waypoint. The altitude of the aircraft is relative to the ground at the take-off location, has a range of [-200,500], and should not be larger than the aircraft's maximum altitude. If two adjacent waypoints have different altitudes, the altitude will gradually change as the aircraft flies between waypoints.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.Waypoint.turnMode
member.summary: Determines whether the aircraft will turn clockwise or anticlockwise when changing its heading.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.Waypoint.heading
member.summary: The heading to which the aircraft will rotate by the time it reaches the waypoint. The aircraft heading will gradually change between two waypoints with different headings if the waypoint mission's headingMode is set to `USING_WAYPOINT_HEADING`. A heading has a range of [-180, 180] degrees, where 0 represents True North.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.Waypoint.gimbalPitch
member.summary: Gimbal pitch angle when reached this waypoint. This property is used when the `WaypointMission` property `bool gimbalPitchRotationEnabled` is true. Value should in range [-90, 0] degree.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.Waypoint.actionRepeatTimes
member.summary: Determines how many times the set of waypoint actions are repeated. The default value is one time, and the maximum is 15.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.Waypoint.actionTimeoutInSeconds
member.summary: The maximum time set to execute all the waypoint actions for a waypoint. If the time while executing the waypoint actions goes above the time set, the aircraft will stop executing the waypoint actions for the current waypoint and will move on to the next waypoint. The value of this property must be in the range of [0, 999] seconds. The default value is 60 seconds.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.Waypoint.cornerRadiusInMeters
member.summary: Corner radius of the waypoint. When the flight path mode is `CURVED` the flight path near a waypoint will be a curve (rounded corner) with radius [0.2,1000]. When there is a corner radius, the aircraft will never go through the waypoint. By default, the radius is 0.2 m. If the corner is made of three adjacent waypoints (Short for A, B, C). Then the radius of A(short for Ra) plus radius of B(short for Rb) must be smaller than the distance between A and B. The radius of the first and the last waypoint in a mission does not affect the flight path and it should keep the default value (0.2m).

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.Waypoint.speed
member.summary: The base automatic speed of the aircraft as it moves between this waypoint and the next waypoint with range [0, 15] m/s. By default, it is 0.0 and the aircraft will fly with `double autoFlightSpeed` of the waypoint mission. If greater than 0, 'speed' will override `double autoFlightSpeed`. This 'speed' can only define movement forward through the waypoint mission in comparison to `double autoFlightSpeed` which can be both forward and backwards through a waypoint mission. Waypoint mission speed priority from highest to lowest is: 1) manual speed adjustment with remote controller joy sticks 2) 'speed' 3) The updated auto flight speed during the mission 4) `double autoFlightSpeed` Warning: 'speed', `double shootPhotoTimeInterval` and `double shootPhotoDistanceInterval` relate to behavior between this waypoint and the next waypoint in the mission. In comparison, turnMode, altitude and heading relate to behavior between the last waypoint and this waypoint in the waypoint mission. Only supported by flight controller firmware 3.2.10.0 or above.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.Waypoint.shootPhotoTimeInterval
member.summary: The time interval in seconds when two photos are taken as the aircraft moves between the current waypoint and the next waypoint. The first photo will be taken as the aircraft leaves the current waypoint. The maximum value is 6,000.0. The minimum value is above 0.0 and depends on the camera type and the camera parameters. When the photo file format is JPEG, the recommended minimum value is 2.0. When the photo file format is RAW, the minimum value is 10.0. If the input exceeds the camera's capability, the pictures will be taken at the maximum possible speed. The default value is 0.0 and no photo will be taken. For a waypoint, either shootPhotoTimeInterval or shootPhotoDistanceInterval is 0.0. Input with precision of greater than 1 decimal places, will be rounded to 1. Warning: 'speed', `double shootPhotoTimeInterval` and `double shootPhotoDistanceInterval` relate to behavior between this waypoint and the next waypoint in the mission. In comparison, turnMode, altitude and heading relate to behavior between the last waypoint and this waypoint in the waypoint mission. Only supported by flight controller firmware 3.2.10.0 or above.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.Waypoint.shootPhotoDistanceInterval
member.summary: The distance interval in meters when two photos are taken as the aircraft moves between the current waypoint and the next waypoint. The maximum value is 6,000.0. The minimum value is above 0.0 and depends on the camera type, the camera parameters and the flight speed. When the photo file format is JPEG, the time interval between two photos cannot smaller than 2 seconds. When the photo file format is RAW, the time interval between two photos cannot smaller than 10 seconds. If the input exceeds the camera's capability, the taken photos may be less than expectation. The default value is 0.0 and no photo will be taken. For a waypoint, either `double shootPhotoTimeInterval` or `double shootPhotoDistanceInterval` is 0.0. Input with precision of greater than 1 decimal places, will be rounded to 1. Warning: 'speed', `double shootPhotoTimeInterval` and `double shootPhotoDistanceInterval` relate to behavior between this waypoint and the next waypoint in the mission. In comparison, turnMode, altitude and heading relate to behavior between the last waypoint and this waypoint in the waypoint mission. Only supported by flight controller firmware 3.2.10.0 or above.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.Waypoint.waypointActions
member.summary: Array of all waypoint actions for the respective waypoint. The waypoint actions will be executed consecutively from the start of the array once the aircraft reaches the waypoint.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMission
member.summary: In the waypoint mission, the aircraft will travel between waypoints, execute actions at waypoints, and adjust heading and altitude between waypoints. Waypoints are physical locations to which the aircraft will fly. Creating a series of waypoints, in effect, will program a flight route for the aircraft to follow. Actions can also be added to waypoints, which will be carried out when the aircraft reaches the waypoint. The aircraft travels between waypoints automatically at a base speed. However, the user can change the speed by using the pitch joystick. If the stick is pushed up, the speed will increase. If the stick is pushed down, the speed will slow down. The stick can be pushed down to stop the aircraft and further pushed to start making the aircraft travel back along the path it came. When the aircraft is travelling through waypoints in the reverse order, it will not execute waypoint actions at each waypoint. If the stick is released, the aircraft will again travel through the waypoints in the original order, and continue to execute waypoint actions (even if executed previously). If the aircraft is pulled back along the waypoint mission all the way to the first waypoint, then it will hover in place until the stick is released enough for it to again progress through the mission from start to finish.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMission.waypointCount
member.summary: Number of waypoints in the waypoint mission. Note there are some cases when the waypoint count will be different to the waypoint array length from `waypoints`. This is usually the case when the waypoint mission is still being downloaded from the aircraft and the mission object hasn't existed previously (e.g. when the mobile device is connected to an aircraft with a previously uploaded mission). In these cases, isComplete will return null.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMission.maxFlightSpeed
member.summary: While the aircraft is travelling between waypoints, you can offset its speed by using the throttle joystick on the remote controller. `maxFlightSpeed` is this offset when the joystick is pushed to maximum deflection. For example, If `maxFlightSpeed` is 10 m/s, then pushing the throttle joystick all the way up will add 10 m/s to the aircraft speed, while pushing down will subtract 10 m/s from the aircraft speed. If the remote controller stick is not at maximum deflection, then the offset speed will be interpolated between [0, `maxFlightSpeed`] with a resolution of 1000 steps. If the offset speed is negative, then the aircraft will fly backwards to previous waypoints. When it reaches the first waypoint, it will then hover in place until a positive speed is applied. `maxFlightSpeed` has a range of [2,15] m/s.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMission.autoFlightSpeed
member.summary: The base automatic speed of the aircraft as it moves between waypoints with range [-15, 15] m/s. The aircraft's actual speed is a combination of the base automatic speed, and the speed control given by the throttle joystick on the remote controller. If `autoFlightSpeed` > 0: Actual speed is `autoFlightSpeed` + Joystick Speed (with combined max of `double maxFlightSpeed`) If autoFlightSpeed = 0: Actual speed is controlled only by the remote controller joystick. If `autoFlightSpeed` < 0 and the aircraft is at the first waypoint, the aircraft will hover in place until the speed is made positive by the remote controller joystick.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMission.finishedAction
member.summary: Action the aircraft will take when the waypoint mission is complete.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMission.headingMode
member.summary: Heading of the aircraft as it moves between waypoints. Default is `AUTO`.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMission.flightPathMode
member.summary: The path the aircraft follows between waypoints. The aircraft can either fly directly between waypoints in a straight line, or turn near a waypoint in the curve where the waypoint location defines a part of the curve.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMission.gotoFirstWaypointMode
member.summary: Defines how the aircraft will go to the first waypoint from its current position. Default is `SAFELY`.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMission.exitMissionOnRCSignalLostEnabled
member.summary: Determines whether the mission should stop when connection between the aircraft and remote controller is lost. Default is `FALSE`.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMission.pointOfInterest
member.summary: Aircraft heading will be fixed to the point of interest location during the waypoint mission. Used when `WaypointMissionHeadingMode headingMode` is `TOWARD_POINT_OF_INTEREST`.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMission.gimbalPitchRotationEnabled
member.summary: `TRUE` if the gimbal pitch rotation can be controlled during the waypoint mission. When `TRUE`, `double gimbalPitch` in `Waypoint` is used to control gimbal pitch.

member.name: F:DJI.WindowsSDK.WaypointMission.repeatTimes
member.summary: Mission execution can be repeated more than once. A value of 0 means the mission only executes once, and does not repeat. A value of 1 means the mission will execute a total of two times.

member.name: T:DJI.WindowsSDK.AirSenseAirplaneState
member.summary: The AirSense state of an airplane. DJI AirSense only sends out warnings of nearby civil aircraft under certain circumstances; it will NOT control DJI aircraft to avoid other aircraft automatically. Make sure to fly with your aircraft within visual line of sight at all times, and always fly with caution. After receiving warnings, lower your aircraft to a safe height. In addition, DJI AirSense has the following limitations: 1. DJI AirSense can only receive messages sent from civil aircraft equipped with an ADS-B out device under 1090ES (RTCA DO-260) or UAT (RTCA Do-282) standards. For civil aircraft without ADS-B outs or with malfunctioning ADS-B outs, DJI AirSense cannot receive related broadcasted messages or send out warnings. 2. When there are obstacles in between a civil aircraft and DJI aircraft, DJI AirSense will fail to receive ADS-B messages sent from civil aircraft or to send out warnings. 3. DJI AirSense may fail to receive ADS-B messages sent from civil aircraft or send out warnings due to ever changing circumstances and interference. It is highly recommended to fly with caution and stay aware of your surroundings during flight. 4. DJI AirSense cannot send out warnings when the DJI aircraft cannot accurately determine its location. 5. DJI AirSense cannot receive ADS-B messages sent from civil aircraft or send out warnings when it is disabled or misconfigured.
